availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, druggist. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Cardwell. Father of Bettie T. Cardwell, Richard Cardwell, and Ellen Cardwell. Druggist in Marion County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned two enslaved individuals in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 548.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 10.
Find A Grave, "Dr. J.M. Cardwell (Feb 9, 1821-Feb 28, 1885)," Memorial #114265649, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114265649 (accessed April 22, 2020).
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989_, Kentucky Marion County Court, Marion County Administrators Bonds, Vol. 3-4, 1879-1901 (Accessed through ancestry.com on April 22, 2020), p. 148 of microfilm.
